intro: Chaetanthera pulvinata var. acuminatibracteata, commonly known as the slender false pimpernel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and hairy stems. The leaves are opposite and often covered in fine pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators.
